intro: Msuata buettneri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and prefers bright, indirect light. Its foliage is often velvety and comes in various shades of green, while its flowers can range from white to purple. Msuata buettneri is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
